answers.answer: My husband suffers from this as well. No he is not a diabetic.  He has good periferal pulses in both lower extermities so no Physician as ever wanted to have and flow studies done. When I was a practicing nurse I  assisted patients in the hospital with the same complaints. Unfortunely I have never heard any Physician, my husband or otherwise, utter any advise other than that there isn't anything that they can do.  I know that it is not encouraging, but please know that you are not alone.
Thank you.  I don't think any of them know.  It's just one of those things.  I will try to move on like it's not there.  Thank you for the "you're not alone part" :)
Has lyme disease been ruled out?

You know, I haven't had the test for it, but the last time I was bitten by a tick was when I was little.  I'm 32 now, so wouldn't it have shown up by now, 20+ yrs later?  I've heard conflicting stories.Thanks for the question!

question: I have burning feet - idiopathic peripheral neuropathy.  Anyone else?  It comes and goes and is really annoying, sometimes, I can't think beyond the pain.  I have been on this site so much, it's ridiculous, just looking for answers and when no answers came - it turned into support.  If there are any fellow "burners" out there....you are not alone!  If anyone has been through this, let me know.  I want to at least talk to others with neuropathy, even if you do have a known cause, like diabetes - check my profile for details.  Maybe we can at least support each other.
title: This hurts and still, STILL no answers.
